lexUnit.name: bawl.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shout out noisily or angrily

sentence.text: ` You know why we 'ave to do tortoises , " the centurion bawled .
Before Luke could stop him , Sonny bawled , ` Ye 've made Una pregnant ! "
` Do n't yow ever let me catch yow using that terrible stuff agen ! " he bawled .
` You 're rubbish Arsenal , " he bawls .
" Charlie ! " he bawled .
` It 's murder , Athelstan ! " he bawled .
` Stop ! " he bawled .
` No ! " he bawled , going red in the face again .
` Come on , Simon ! " he bawled .
` Nourishin' stews , that 'll do the trick ! " bawled Mr Beavis from the passage .
` Rafferty ! " bawled the sergeant-major .
` Forty-seven , " bawled the adjudicator , who was growing hoarse .
While Donna lay in the bathtub , inaccurately bawling the bits she could remember of My Fair Lady , Alex dialled Matthew 's number , only to find that he had switched on his answering machine .
" Move ! " bawled the drill corporal .
` Ruined ! " bawled Gambo uncontrollably .
The child thrashed and bawled something cheerful in its sleep and lay still again .
He made a move towards her and bawled at her to ` get out " , which she did but not without slamming the door for all she was worth behind her .
Doctor Rice would n't have chatted with her like he was doing ; he would have bawled at her and said , ` I 'll see him .
And many were the times when she had wanted to bawl at him , ` And who was to blame for that ?
She straightened up now and bawled across at him , ` You were a lad ; now you 're a young man .
` If it had taken place in London or New York I would have simply bawled at him to get lost .
The coroner bawled at the porter to follow them and , for the second time that day , Athelstan heard the confession of a man about to meet Death .
` You 're all shitehawks and muckrakers , " the bearded publican bawled at them .
Corbett struggled to his feet and stared around the hall where the rest of the sleepers there were slowly rising to their feet , some nursing sore heads , others bawling for wine and food .
` Who 's mekin' all this racket ? " he bawled in a thunderous voice .
Literally translated , Vogelsang means ` bird song " , but it was some time before the dawn chorus when the Squadron Sergeant Major bawled out the orders for reveille .
They are happy to suspend disbelief for the season of goodwill and lustily to bawl out the carols with beery breath and watch dewy-eyed as the little ones do their stuff .
His arm was round one of his companions , while both bawled out an indecent love ditty .
Next ball , Cec bawled out another appeal at full bore .
Turning his head , he bawled over his shoulder for his companions to follow him , and was answered by muffled shouts from deeper in the woods .
We followed her to the foot of the stairs and she bawled up it , ` Otto ?
Shopkeepers bawled and yelled at him .
